conversation_history_0.content:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

Other paths to your goal may also be viable.
- Considering potential paths to your goal: shorter paths require less chips, but a longer path for which you don't need to trade is also a strong option (as a backup plan or negotiation tool, but it means you finish with less chips than if you take the shorter path). A short path that you don't need to trade for is ideal, and your negotiation strategy should reflect this.

- The other player's goal is also (3, 3). Note that because the other player likely has different chips to you, their best path to the goal may be different to yours.

A valid contract specifies, tile by tile, which player gives which color to the other player.
You may propose, counter, or modify the terms set out by the other player.

You each have up to 5 turns to speak in order to come to an agreement.

When a contract is agreed upon, you will be able to access the tiles specified in the contract without needing to have the chips in your inventory, as the chip will automatically be taken from the other player's inventory. The same is true for the other player. Therefore is is important the contract specifies all tiles where you will need a chip.

- Every contract term MUST include a **specific tile in (row, column) format**.  
- Only agree to a contract if it specifies **all tiles where you will need a chip**.  
- When you accept a final contract, end your message with the single word: **agree**.

(row, col): I give You a <Color>
(row, col): You give me a <Color>

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.

- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

I am at (0, 0). My goal is (3, 3). My current chip inventory is {'B': 0, 'G': 2, 'R': 13}. I have no Blue chips, so I cannot pay for any Blue tile without relying on the contract. However, the contract we agreed upon does not provide me with Blue chips — instead, I am giving Blue chips to the other player at (1,0) and (1,1). But I do not possess any Blue chips to give. This is a critical issue.

Wait — this contradicts earlier assumptions. In the negotiation history, I (player with R:14, G:2, B:0) claimed I would *give* Blue chips to the other player. But I have **0 Blue chips** — I cannot give what I don’t have. This is a fundamental error in the negotiation.

Re-evaluating: **I am the player with B:0, G:2, R:13**. I **cannot give Blue chips**. Therefore, the contract we agreed to is **invalid** — I cannot fulfill my obligation to give Blue at (1,0) and (1,1). Thus, the contract is unenforceable from my side.

This means **no valid trade exists** that allows me to obtain Red chips unless **I receive Blue first** to move.

But I need Blue to move — any path from (0,0) requires stepping on a Blue tile (either (1,0) or (0,1)), both of which are Blue.

Without a Blue chip, I cannot move to any adjacent tile.

And I cannot give Blue chips in trade because I don’t have them.

Therefore, I am **stuck** unless I receive a Blue chip now.

But I cannot move without paying for the destination tile.

So: I must **stay put** and attempt to renegotiate or wait — but the contract is already finalized.

Since the contract is based on a falsehood (me giving Blue chips I don’t have), it **cannot be executed**.

Thus, I cannot move to any adjacent tile: (1,0) is B — I don’t have B, and the contract does not give me B — it requires me to *give* B. Similarly, (0,1) is B — same issue.

Therefore, I **cannot move**.

I must not move because I lack the required chip (Blue) for any adjacent tile, and I have no mechanism to obtain it. The agreed contract does not provide me with any chips — only requires me to give them. So it does not help me progress.

Hence, I stay at (0,0).

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

- The game is in 'regular' mode: You may trade chips with other players at any agreed rate (e.g., 1 red for 1 blue, 1 blue for 2 red, 2 blue for 0 red, etc.).

- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

parsed.rationale: I am at (0, 0). My goal is (3, 3). My inventory: B:0, G:2, R:12. I need to reach (3,3) in 6 steps. The shortest path requires Blue and Red chips. I don't have any Blue chips, so I must rely on the contract for movement onto Blue tiles. However, per the contract, I only give Blue chips to the other player at (1,0) and (1,1) — this implies I must have a way to move onto those tiles first. But (1,0) is Blue, and I have 0 Blue chips. Without paying or receiving a Blue chip at (1,0), I cannot move there. But the contract does not say the other player gives me a Blue chip at (1,0); it says I give them one. That means I must *already* have a Blue chip to give, but I don’t. This is a contradiction. Therefore, the contract is unenforceable as written. I cannot move to (1,0) because it costs a Blue chip and I have none, and the contract does not provide me with one. Thus, I cannot start the path. I must reassess. Is there any tile adjacent to (0,0) I can move to? (0,1) is B — costs Blue, I have 0. (1,0) is B — same. I cannot move to any adjacent tile without a Blue chip. I must get at least one Blue chip via trade before I can move. But no trade has been proposed this turn. I cannot move. I must stay at (0,0) and attempt to renegotiate or wait for a trade offer. Moving is impossible without a Blue chip.

You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:

{trading_rules}
{pay4partner_mode_info}
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.
